results.title: By the seat of our pants
results.creator_credit: Task Force, Social Welfare Dept of Victoria, Peter Norton, Julie Cutler and Peter Monger
results.brief_description: A film about the problems of unemployment. Interspersed with comments from sympathetic as well as unsympathetic ‘experts’, four young people living in Prahran tell their stories of largely unfortunate experiences with employers and government institutions.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Task Force, Social Welfare Dept of Victoria, Peter Norton, Julie Cutler and Peter Monger

results.title: By the light of the moon
results.creator_credit: Christine Rogers, Broadmeadows Secondary College, Alex Vagic and Media, Applied Communications, RMIT
results.brief_description: “By the light of the moon” tells the story of two refugee girls, their reasons for leaving their home countries, their experiences, and how they came to be living in Broadmeadows and attending the Broadmeadows Secondary College. Essentially the film is about hope and optimism. Despite the difficulties faced by the two girls, and an acknowledgement that they can never forget the past, through sharing their stories they gain acceptance. They begin to connect with the community in which they now live, and have hope for the future.

results.title: By nature's rules
results.creator_credit: Jim Lawless Motion Picture Consultants and Jim Lawless
results.brief_description: A doctor describes the condition of hypothermia, or exposure sickness, detailing its gradual effect on the mind and body. This slow numbing process of physical and mental faculties is then shown in a dramatic enactment of the experiences of a group of hikers who vary in stamina and in their knowledge of the dangers of inadequate protection against changes in weather. When one experienced climber recognizes the symptoms of hypothermia and takes positive action the symptoms and treatment of this insidious malady are clearly demonstrated.

results.title: By hook or by crook
results.creator_credit: Christian Television Association of Victoria and Russell Sefton
results.brief_description: A film about early Christian Art examining the aesthetics and in particular, that of the catacombs of Rome. Pays special attention to the culltural-historical context from which it evolved. Presented by Barry Marshall.

results.title: By design?
results.creator_credit: Victoria. Dept. of Education and Early Childhood Development and Diane O'Connor
results.brief_description: Provides a behind the scene look at the world of fashion. People from Cherry Lane fashion house, “Dolly” and “Mode” magazines and the Australian Wool corporation talk about what is involved in predicting fashions trends, designing, producing garments and putting together fashion.

results.title: By Brakhage: an anthology
results.brief_description: Influential American avant-garde artist Stan Brakhage (1933-2003) made nearly four hundred films over fifty years. Addressing grand themes of birth, sex and death, Brakhage pioneered the art of handmade films - scratching, drawing and painting directly on to the film itself. This compilation contains twenty-six works by Brakhage including some of his most famous titles. Interviews and audio commentary by Brakhage, as well as an accompanying booklet, provide a fascinating insight into his philosophical and technical processes.

results.title: Buzkashi: the national game (D)
results.creator_credit: Julien Bryan, International Film Foundation and Hermann Schlenker
results.brief_description: WARNING: THIS FILM CONTAINS SOME VISUALLY DISTURBING IMAGES Buzkashi is the once forbidden sport performed on horseback by the tribes of Afghanistan. Buzkashi requires incredible riding ability, as the opposing teams battle for a head-less calf. the intense pride and rivalry of a tribal society, as well as the role of physical superiority and competition are implicit. No commentary - natural sound track only.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Julien Bryan, International Film Foundation and Hermann Schlenker

results.title: Buying Toys
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “PGR Series”.
Examines types of toys appropriate for different age groups, storage hints, the issue of sexism and how to resist pressures from TV, advertising and cartoons.

results.title: Buying services
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Consumer skills”.
Shows the need for savings and the importance of investing wisely. Uses the experiences of a young man involved in an automobile accident to illustrate the importance of being financially prepared through having shopped around for the best insurance cover. Suitable for upper secondary level.
